concept.title: Expression Language
concept.shortdesc: The expression language enables you to create expressions that evaluate or modify data. Use the expression language to create expressions in the Expression processor and conditions in the Stream Selector processor.

dlentry.dd: Precede all expressions with a dollar sign and enclose them with curly brackets, as follows:${<expression>}
For example, to add 2 +2, use the following syntax:${2+2}.

To use the values in a field in an expression, use the following syntax:record:value{"/<field_name>"}
For example, to add the sales of four quarters, you might use the following expression: ${record:value("/Q1_Sales") + record:value("/Q2_Sales") + record:value("/Q3_Sales") + record:value("/Q4_Sales")}
You can use operators in expressions. what type of operators?
You can use constants in expressions. You can also define a constant variable. You can use the variable to represent a constant for any expression in the processor.
